review_text: We loved Cambria! And staying at Ann-Marie's! My husband especially liked the shower (we may be doing a remodel. lol) I enjoyed sun-bathing on the private deck since it was too windy and cold to lay out on the beach the week we spent there. The place is exactly as pictured and Ann-Marie would check in to make sure everything was okay. It was perfect for our first trip to California.

name: Lesley
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We loved this place!! We are on a long road trip and this stop felt quite unique and special. It consists of a bedroom with huge comfortable bed, compact cupboard kitchenette(microwave, kettle-no stove) and large bathroom and beautiful deck overlooking fairly wild lovely garden. The large tastefully tiled shower area does not need an overhead light-plenty of light comes from the main bathroom area. There is no TV which was fine for us. The cabin room and deck is in a quiet residential area which is about 20-30min walk into central Cambria-to note this is in part down some fairly steep steps so not for everyone. Access by car very easy. Cambria is charming. Check out wild ginger takeaway. The quality cabin has a very relaxing vibe. Can highly recommend.

review_text:
Very well cared for and private location. Perfect place to meditate, plan and read, as well as enjoy the nature and look at the stars. We had only one night unfortunately, but would hav happily stayed for longer. It’s very relaxing.
The thing to know - it’s difficult to shower at night, as there is no light inside the shower cabin and it’s dark. However if you get used to it, I suppose you could do it.
The little inbuilt kitchen had both relaxing and energising type of teas. This is rarely what hosts think about, but Ann-Marie had it there. Very much appreciated to relax for the night.
Super soft and cozy bed too. Thank you!

review_text: Ann-Marie was very friendly and gave great recommendations for the area! I was working while traveling and had some issues with the WiFi dropping several times throughout my stay during meetings, which was very disruptive. Thankfully, the connection would come back quickly. The other issue I had was that the iron was dirty and leaked a yellowish white liquid. Outside of that, I had a great stay. The room was private and while it did not really have access to the yard in the photos, the back patio was very pleasant.

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Ann-Marie is truly a super Superhost. We have stayed at many AirBnB's around the world and her place is a truly lovely experience. It’s clear that she really cares about everything and that this place isn’t here just to make a buck. Everything is of good quality and immaculately clean, well maintained and very comfortable. The mattress is so nice, new and not worn out. She provides everything we could think that anyone would need and more. We were arriving late so she made sure we could easily get in and even turned on the heat for us since it was January and a bit chilly at night. The location is very close to the Hearst Castle and cute downtown Cambria. The neighborhood is very safe, secure and peaceful.

review_text: This is a lovely in-law space in a beautiful neighborhood. The kitchenette was in the large closet (one side) which was OK except there was no running water. There was water in the bathroom but our instructions were to just leave dirty dishes if we were only staying for a few days (which we were). We had ants, which to be perfectly fair to our host, we did not say anything about. So, we just did the few dishes we had in the bathroom sink going forward and cleaned up the ants - no big deal. We would stay there again for sure.

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: It was a Complete Delight staying here! Turning onto the street we were surprised by a group of 10 turkeys leisurely walking towards us down the very center of the road. We let them pass and continued on , we also saw a young deer beside the road in the greenery. The Garden gate was a little hard to find, we had to make a U turn and go back for a second look. And then I saw my name on a tiny Welcome Sign on the gate. It's a lovely, quaint, restful cottage. The only thing we missed was a TV. We knew by the listing that it doesn't have one, we thought it wouldn't matter but we missed it. However , it caused us to improvise and we played some games and laughed a lot. The King, bed was very comfortable. The neighborhood is quiet and we slept well. Sitting in the 2 chairs on the wood deck gives you the feeling of being up in a treehouse. A good spot to enjoy morning coffee. Thank you for sharing your slice of paradise. 😊

Parking area is not right next to the entrance and has a long walkway that is well lit with path lights. Just be aware if arriving at night. Highly recommend dining at Dorn's in Morro Bay and walking the Cambria Moonstone Beach boardwalk starting at the Santa Rosa Creek parking lot on Moonstone Beach Drive.

name: Natalie

July 2023

·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Ann-Marie's location is a breathtakingly sweet getaway.
The location feels so much more tucked away than it actually is in the surrounding neighborhood because this AirBnB has its own essence and substantial space. You will feel comfortable and safe here thanks to all the little accommodations that she has prepared. The shower and bathroom are large, the kitchenette includes plenty of helpful elements for a traveler, and the vibe is feminine, peaceful, and earthy.
My ONLY two minor criticisms of this nearly perfect place:
1) The bed was very soft; I personally had some trouble sleeping on it. But I'm sure it would be many people's cup of tea depending on your preferences!
2) It would have been nice to have a light for the shower; though the stonework is GORGEOUS, it was a bit awkward showering essentially in the dark.
Those are the ONLY two things I can think of. Definitely one of the finest AirBnBs I have been to, especially considering the location. Highly recommended.

review_text: We really enjoyed our stay here. The deck and surrounding garden were so beautiful and the neighborhood is almost completely silent it’s so quiet. The space itself was a good size for 2 people, big comfy bed, beautiful bathroom, and nice decor. Other reviews stated that it was cold in the unit, but I found the heater worked amazingly well. We used the space heater in the bathroom, but otherwise we were quite cozy during our rainy weeklong stay. It would’ve been nice to have a tv since it rained so much during our stay, but otherwise everything was perfect. We would love to come again.

A gorgeous wild garden setting, was fun to check out new blooms each day! The room has a small kitchenette and an ultra-large tiled shower…as my spouse quipped, “seats six!” When we return to our beloved Cambria, we’ll be sure to try and stay here again. TY, Ann-Marie!

name: Emma
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars

·
December 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This place is tucked in a quiet and private neighborhood of Cambria, it's super close to trails, downtown and the beach (you can't really go wrong with Cambria as it's super tiny). Everything is 5-10 mins driving distance.
On to the basics: internet is slow, could be cold at night, but our host provided a space heater that worked perfectly. Bed - memory foam, a bit soft for me but it was fine. Our host has coffee, tea and half and half, which was very convenient. The lid of the coffee pot was not attached to the pot, so it slipped to my cup of coffee while I was pouring my coffee from the pot. Shower - unfortunately wasn't very hot, I took a shower at night and felt cold the whole time and cold after shower. I tried it again during the day and it was even colder.
Cleanliness: everything is very clean. I think the pillow may have smelled a bit of mildewy for me, I got these smells on my hair the next day.
Communication is slow. Stylish place but could use bit more care.

Needless to say, I was super cozy! Everything was super clean and I would definitely stay here again!

I had to call Katy about a question I had and she was right there for us. The showers were new and were so great. The heater heats up the place quickly. We definitely will be back. My 14 year old daughter wants me to buy this house. I wish! Too bad we are stuck in the rat race Bay Area. Hahah! I hope everyone enjoys this house like we did. I can’t imagine anyone not. ·
April 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a lovely stand-alone house in the middle of a very rural residential community (probably very wealthy too) on the ocean-side of Cambria amidst pine and oak groves on the bluffs sloping down to stunning California Central Coast where you can get views of the ocean (a short walk, not directly from the property). Interior provides expansive kitchen, fully equipped, dining room and large bedrooms as described. Exterior amenities include a hot tub that works, also outdoor seating and a small wild garden to have some privacy if the weather is nice (happened to be cold when we were there). It's not convenient to restaurants, so cooking-in was the better option, and there is at least one decent-sized grocery store in Cambria across the other side of the 101 freeway. As along most of this part of the coast, the beaches are not really for swimming, but they are beautiful and wild to walk along. San Simeon and Paso Robles are short drives away. I would go again.

It’s a great space for a couple of families, girls weekend, romantic getaway, or serenity for solo travelers.

name: Shannon
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2022
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Katy's place was absolutely amazing! It was the perfect house for several generations of family to gather, and even a couple of dogs!
The house is spacious, clean, and comfortable. The kitchen was well equipped, which made it easy to prepare meals for our group of six. The backyard is charming, and I was surprised at how much space and privacy it had. The dogs loved running around and we enjoyed starting the day with a cup of coffee in the many sitting areas outside.
The shutters on the windows blocked out nearly all light, and the beds were so cozy. There is clearly a lot of thought put into this space, and we enjoyed every minute of our time here.
Just a couple of tiiiny notes: The driveway does fit two cars, but it can be a tight fit. Wasn't a problem for us, but something to know if you have larger vehicles. We also didn't notice any separate towels for the hot tub, but luckily we had some beach towels in the car that we were able to use. We did need to make use of the washer and dryer during our time here, but we couldn't find any laundry detergent in the house. We made a quick trip to the grocery store up the road and were able to pick some up though - just something to keep in mind if you plan to use the washer!
Overall, it was a 10/10 experience and we would absolutely stay again!

So many recliners, it was hard to choose which one to nap in. The evenings were cool enough to use the fireplace.
We really took advantage of the central location, visiting from Morro Bay to Big Sur and inland to Atascadero, Templeton and Paso Robles, even though we were often so comfortable we were reluctant to leave the house.
And the weather. A beautiful mix of sun and fog.
Since we live in the Palm Springs area this was such a nice break from the summer heat.
We've been to Cambria many times over the years but this was one of the best trips ever.

rating_info:

review_text:
Surprisingly roomy and clean with lots of everything-- furniture, kitchen stuff, laundry, comfy beds, hot tub, fireplace, TV with all apps available (NetFlix, etc), clear instruction book, quick host response, plus more. Easy access to Fiscalini Ranch. Great hikes there.
Hot tub was very clean, but neighbors are closeby. Bring a swim suit! Cambria can get cool at night so the outdoor fireplace is good. The indoor heating system works REALLY well. House was warm in no time on cool February evenings.
Less stars on location because it was close to some other houses and Ardath Drive, which has some road noise. Still, nothing to complain about as the noise did not bother us much. Next door neighbor was playing basketball during our nap (boo hoo for us). We just moved to another room as it was just the two of us.
Plenty of room for six people to have a fun time. Third bedroom is set up for kids (2 small beds).
We will rent again when we plan our next Cambria trip.

The porch is perfect for watching nature, and the jacuzzi is fabulous after a day of sightseeing or hiking.
It is about a 5 minute drive to town, and the beaches are very close.

When we got back to the house afterward the deer came to us! We opened the door to see 5 deer grazing right across the street so peacefully. Sitting on the porch watching the deer was definitely a highlight. Our dog loved staying here with us so much. He snored in front of the fireplace both days and loved laying on the porch as we drank our coffee. The hot tub was really nice to relax your muscles at the end of the day and the tree lights added pretty ambiance. The bed was huge and very comfy and the backyard is a lush oasis. Every aspect of this stay was perfect and it brought us so much joy to stay in this special home in the heart of Cambria. Thank you Katy for making it possible! We had the best stay and felt like a Christmas hallmark movie :-)

First of all, Katy is fast to reply any inquiries I had prior to the arrival, and very generous and flexible with checkin time and having our tiny pet friends in cages. Just like other guests commented, the house is very clean, has so many different options to hang around inside the house and out in the backyard or front yard, has more than ample storage, the kitchen and bathrooms fully equipped, the entire house decorated nicely with cute animal and ocean themes. Beds we used in the two rooms were very comfy, and the reclining chairs in the living room were awesome and perfect for watching TV or socializing around the fireplace. We also took advantage of the fabulous back deck for early dinner and a breakfast and enjoyed the wild squirrels being active on the trees. The location was perfect. We decided to watch the sunset at the Fiscalini Ranch Preserve right nearby. And boy we were happy when we saw the fantastic view of the Pacific. We saw small and big dear in the neighborhood. We made some unforgettable memories and would definitely come back to Katy’s place. Thank you Katy!

review_text: Very roomy house with tons of closet space--especially if you are staying for an extended time. Can't beat having 2 Cal King beds--so very comfortable! Two very comfortable twins as well. The front porch extends the entire length of the house--great view of the wildlife. Nice nooks to sit in backyard too! The best part is your location to everything in Cambria and being able to walk a few houses down the street to the trailhead for the Fiscalini Ranch Preserve--so many trails! The decor has it's own personality! So many fun touches! One thing to note: you are one house from a busier neighborhood street--so you will see and hear the people who leave for work in the morning as you sit on the front porch. Didn't bother me, but if you are expecting it to be very quiet, it's not. And the skylights (front porch, bedrooms, hall bath and family room) make the house feel so open! Only the master rooms doesn't have them. Great shutters on all windows for privacy when needed. All in all, I can't wait to come back here!

review_text: We really needed a break, and we sank right into this lovely home. The house is right in the charming hillside neighborhood of Cambria. It looks like a modest ranch house from outside, but inside every detail has been superlatively attended to. The kitchen is exceedingly well furnished, there are multiple TVs, and there are all kinds of places to just sit and relax. First, there is the long front porch, offering a view of passing deer and turkeys. In the enclosed back yard, there's a rustic corner with a gas stove, a gas grill, and of course, the hot tub. All three bedrooms are thematically decorated -- kids, teen, and adults. My favorite spot was the chaise lounge by the front window, where I could lie and read and keep an eye on passing wildlife. You're in a residential area, but it was very quiet. The ocean is a short drive, or a long walk, and there are lots of places to hike. When you go to town, visit the garden courtyard of stories, including the Ocean Heir shop for great books, clothes, cards, gifts, etc. Speaking of which, I loved all the mermaid, whale, squirrel, deer, etc., decorations in the house. The only reason I didn't check "outstanding hospitality" is because we were self-sufficient on our stay, but there was nothing we needed. My only warning is we didn't have cell phone reception. To me, that was a blessing!

The place was spotless and checking in was a breeze. Katy was super communicative and we had no problems at all. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a peaceful, easy Cambria getaway.

name: Mary

Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: What a rollercoaster visit to Cambria and Katy's house. First the house... we loved her house! The location was beautiful and the first two mornings, I enjoyed my tea on the front porch watching the deer across the street. The perfect way to start the day! Tuesday night, a raging storm hit Cambria and a large tree fell up the block, knocking out power. I went into town to call Katy who was very responsive and sympathetic. The power never came back on so we used the fireplace to warm up and cooked dinner by candlelight. With the rain pounding the roof (and a good bottle of local wine), it was peaceful and relaxing! The next morning the power was still off so we needed to cut our stay short and head home. Katy was very gracious and refunded the last unused night which we really appreciated. Back to the house... it's just down the street from a beautiful hiking trail into the ranchlands (which we really enjoyed with our two dogs). The house has well-stocked pots, pans, plates, bowls, glasses, knives, etc., a comfortable master bed, excellent heat, a lovely gas fireplace, and a really pretty backyard (in the fun and funky Cambria style). We sat in the sun in the yard but otherwise it was too chilly to eat outside. Be sure to bring your own laundry detergent, olive oil, coffee, tea, etc. (as well as extra toilet paper if you are staying for more than a weekend) and know that cell service is almost non-existent at the house (but wifi is great -- if you have power!). Katy's house (and Cambria) was the perfect place to enjoy our first get-away since the beginning of the pandemic. Already checking her calendar for the next opening! :)

review_text: We really enjoyed our stay here. The house is very close to Fiscalini Ranch and was very quiet during our stay as it’s not on a busy road. We enjoyed seeing deer out front in the mornings, and if it’s a clear night you can see tons of stars. The house also had great natural light with all the skylights (none in the master bedroom which was appreciated). The other two bedrooms did have skylights. The bed was very comfortable. My 1.5 year old daughter and our dog loved the backyard and it was actually bigger than expected. Since cell reception isn’t great in the area it was nice to have working wi-fi and there was also a house phone if needed. Overall we had an amazing time and would stay here again in the future.

Beautiful, well-stocked, cozy unit that overlooks the woods. Very convenient location close to Highway 1 and Downtown Cambria.
The unit offers a lot of privacy, but I would recommend meeting the hosts if you get the chance. They’re very responsive, sweet, and knowledgeable about the area—and amazing bakers too! They shared some almond torte they had made prior to our arrival, and it was among the best that I’ve ever had.
We unfortunately only had one night to spare here, but we wish we could have spent more time at the place and with the hosts. Highly recommend this Airbnb to anyone planning a trip in the central coast.

review_text:
Found Diane and Dutch's place last minute. Quite location overall, positioned off the backside of their home (not attached to main home). Had what we needed for a short 24 hour trip, however very small. If we planned to eat in we would've liked a table with chairs, had a TV tray instead. The bed was very comfortable for watching a show, but when sleeping, VERY uncomfortable. It would be WELL worth investing in a more comfortable mattress. Midway through the night we had to alternate the direction of our sleep, so we didn't feel like a taco (I am 165lbs and my husband is 175lbs, so weight should not be an issue). Also, the fire alarm went off for no apparent reason other than the shower steam (with which we had the fan on but it didn't help).
Overall, 4 out of 5 stars, and would recommend for the location, peace and quiet, friendliness of the hosts, ease of entry and exit. Bed is a definite downfall.

review_text:
I stayed here for a quick retreat with my friend, and it turned out to be the perfect home base to explore Big Sur and surrounding cities such as Morro Bay. Location was amazing; super close to Cambria and we had a delicious dinner and breakfast treats at Linn’s restaurant and pie bakery (per the host’s recommendation). Close to highway one and many ocean vistas that are great for stargazing.
Diane and Dutch’s place was spotlessly clean, thoughtfully stocked with amenities such as K-cup pods and granola bars / road trip snacks, and the bathroom was so comfy. The porch showed gorgeous forest views as promised in the pictures, along with a cute garden that felt very relaxing to sit in. Due to the place being dark at night, would recommend arriving before dark and being a little careful pulling up into the driveway, but host was there to greet us and show us the way. 10/10 stay!

review_text:
Last minute daytrip to San Simeon and found this pristine peaceful location with wonderful hosts for a last minute overnight stay.
A glass of wine on the patio while stargazing with our telescope after dinner at Linn’s, a trickling water fountain in the property background, indoor fireplace and comfortable bed, played the provided battleship game at night with my son. My morning tea among the trees with butterflies floating in the trees, scrubjays drinking from the fountain, hummingbirds fluttering by and tiny wild canaries fleeting and drinking while other birds soar in the sky.
Such a peaceful delightful comfortable stay with well thought out appointments and decor and gracious hosts. Loved this little gem would definitely come back ❤️🥂. Thank you Diane and Hutch for your hospitality and kindness I didn’t even know how much I needed this stay until I got here.

name: Matt
rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars

·

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The hosts are nice people, but I booked "The Tree House" for my wife and me as a base for exploring Cambria, and once we saw the space, we literally turned around and left.
The room is tiny, and there is very little privacy. There is a room for a double or queen-sized bed and MAYBE 75 sq ft of additional space.
A couple of windows in the room look right out into the host's backyard. The host's front door is just a few feet from the entrance to the "Tree House," which is more of a small writing room turned into an Airbnb.
If you're staying by yourself and all you need is a bed to sleep in, the Tree House has that. And, as I said, the hosts are nice. But I don't feel the room was as advertised, and the photos make it look bigger than it is. We paid in advance, so it was just a waste of a few hundred dollars.
I felt like a first-class idiot when my wife and I saw this tiny space. Luckily, we were able to find a room at the Cambria Pines Lodge, which saved our anniversary weekend.

review_text:
Diane and Dutch’s space is a lovely, studio with tons of natural light and surrounded by decks and trees. The front door opens onto a magical, lush natural forested hillside with lichen draped trees, and deers and turkeys ambling by. There are also some nice seating areas scattered around the multi-leveled yard/ decks which we did not have the time to enjoy but looked super comfy with spectacular views.
We stayed for 4 nights to hike the coastal areas surrounding Cambria and their place was a great home base for us with special added extras such as muffins baked by Diane and locally grown grapes (which were come of the best I’ve ever had!). It is also super close to downtown Cambria and the fantastic natural market True Earth.
The studio is surprisingly well-equipped for the size and D & D thought of just about everything to make the space a wonderful place to spend time.

A delightful stay! We came for the Christmas Market, and the accommodations and hosts were amazing! Great communication from start until finish, friendly, helpful, and attentive! Short walk to Christmas Market (which we highly recommend, btw), but also private, peaceful, and beautiful location (in a little wood! We even saw a deer right on the property!).
Super comfortable and convenient accommodations (highlights for me: memory foam mattress and electric fireplace heater). These hosts deserve an award for how cleverly they fit in nearly every amenity you could think of in such an efficient and artistic way (loved the nautical/beach theme!). Decorated for Christmas and provided homemade Christmas cookies and banana bread upon our arrival! Got to meet the hosts at their booth at the Xmas Market where they gave us great advice for our planned drive up the coast.
We would definitely stay here again; we highly recommend the place. Many thanks to Diane and Dutch!

Super responsive and checked in with us to see if we needed anything, even letting us know that the nearby Christmas Market was testing their holiday lights so we could go see them (we were bummed that we came too early for the market, but excited to see the lights!). They made us cupcakes on arrival, but also gave us all the privacy we needed. Couldn’t ask for a better and more relaxing stay!

The only reason I gave the "value" 4 stars is that I feel the entire system along with it's fees is almost pricing itself out of the market...not just this unit, all of them

My fifth time at the house and I will be back. zI stayed for six weeks this time and worked remotely. It is so quiet and Jason's wifi is blazing fast. Fiscalini is practically next door to the house and my main focus -- the elephant seals in San Simeon -- are just 12 minutes away. The house is small, cozy and perfect for my needs. I bring a load of stuff because I'm pedantic about grinding my coffee, having my own pillows and work chair, but the rental is very well-stocked. The bed is exceptionally comfortable, everything works as it should, and Jason is responsive.
The best endorsement is that I just reserved 7 weeks for next year.

Stayed with kids
review_text: We enjoyed hiking 3 miles every morning with our elementary age kids. The trails are kid friendly. The neighborhood deer were always around. Quiet neighborhood. I saw complaints about the driveway but it was not an issue at all. If you can park in a standard parking space then you’ll have no problem. Check out g**gle maps before going so you know what to expect. No problem finding the house. The side yard was perfect for the kids to play and it’s a very safe neighborhood. There’s a farmers market on Friday afternoon right in the middle of the “downtown” strip of shopping/restaurants. The house had plenty of high quality towels, sheets, blankets, etc. There’s a trick to using the door knobs but we figured it out fairly quickly. The laundry closet just outside the back door. No AC but plenty of windows for lots of air flow and a fireplace to warm up. We were able to cook meals and enjoyed meals outside on the deck.

review_text:
Cozy place for a small family or couple. Overall, would recommend this place. House is well-maintained and looked just like the pictures. Nicely stocked kitchen. Accommodations thought out for guests.
Negatives:
House is very hard to fine, we had to do two different drive-bys to even find the house. Also, driveway is super small, my midsize SUV barely fit. Overgrown trees cover the house and the house number isn’t very visible, look for the mail box on the opposite side of the road and it’s directly across the street
The French doors were a pain to deal with especially with small children. They were easily unlocked by children and made leaving the house a pain to get them to lock.

We didn’t cook but the kitchen was well stocked with everything you would need to do so. We enjoyed the food in Cambria with lots of recommendations in the house book. Only place I would add is Boni’s, a taco truck located at Main and Burton that has amazing food!

Jason was easy to get ahold of and very responsive to my inquiries. He also provided great directions to get to the local trailheads -- which are easy to walk and have incredible views!

The cottage itself is clean, comfortable, and well appointed. Jason was a great host. We ate at The Black Cat Bistro and Indigo Moon. Both were delicious, and they're about a five minute drive from the cottage. We would definitely stay here again.

There was a gas fireplace/heating unit in the living room that was easy to use, verty pretty to watch and very effective in heating the unit. The bathroom was pure HGTV. The bed was top quality and very comfy. There was plenty of space to stow our belongings and keep our lodging neat. The neighborhood was perfect for us. As we walked to the Fiscalli Preserve we enjoyed the many deer who roam freely in the neighborhood.

The home is located conveniently to area's nature attractions, stores and shops. We would definitely stay here again without any hesitation!!

review_text: A perfect retreat for a solo trip (though a couple or small family would also fit here nicely). The house is nestled in the trees on the lot and is also within walking distance of Fiscalini Ranch (a must for me!). The glass French doors are a nice touch, displaying the setting sun in the front and, if you’re lucky, deer from the back. But also there’s a wonderful front deck with comfortable chairs for feeling even closer to nature. The neighborhood is super quiet. The big master suite is upstairs and the living area downstairs, a footprint I really liked. Within a matter of minutes you can be in town where there are many excellent restaurants to choose from should you decide not to cook. Overall very comfortable and with everything I needed. I absolutely would stay here again.

So pleased with this rental it has everything you could need, great beds, good kitchen, fun TV included Disney+ you will love being in close proximity to a beautiful trail to the sea. Did I say I love it!....Love it 💕

During my stay, in the morning I look forward to opening the blinds. Grey fog or blue skies. The windows frame old, gnarled oak trees and evergreens. Wild turkeys and deer visit. Each evening I walk the sea bluffs and sometimes sight whales, porpoises, otters, or seals. I am a repeat guest and the hosts have always been very kind and accommodating.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This home is wonderful. Perfect walking distance to Fiscalini. I highly recommend hiking through the area. Minutes from downtown Cambria. Expect to see deer in the yard. Though shy, they came by daily to sit beneath the shady trees in the yard. At night, you can hear the seals. I already miss it. Stop by Moonstone Beach, a short drive. Or even go see Hearst Beach/Hearst Castle-- a short 15 minute drive away.
The washer and dryer are located outside the home, in an outdoor accessible closet. Very user friendly and very useful for our stay. They provided coffee and a coffee maker. But be sure to bring sugar and creamer if that's your thing. The neighborhood felt incredibly friendly and safe. Our first morning, our neighbor came outside, collected his paper and said: "Good morning World." That is the essence of this area. Everyone seemed happy to be there, happy to meet you.

We walked down the street to the Fiscalini preserve, liked seeing the deer and Turkey munching in everyone’s yards, especially the two babies. Well equipped kitchen. This was our first time to stay at this cottage and will definitely book our next trip.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We really wanted to love this place... we appreciated the communication and the cleanliness of the property; however, there were just things we couldn't get over. The driveway was really difficult to navigate. If you have a larger truck or SUV, you'll run the risk of hitting a low-hanging tree branch. Be sure to park backward. We didn't realize the bathroom was on the second level, while the laundry was outside; not mentioned the listing. There were a lot of spiders everywhere, which is probably normal for the area, but we killed at least 6-7. There was no mention of having to put the garbage cans out on the street, then bring them back in; this will happen on a Thursday. It wasn't exactly easy to get to a beach from the property either. Ultimately, the bed was extremely uncomfortable, resulting in my need to seek immediate massage therapy and be referred to a chiropractor. I wanted to love it, but it was more work and a hassle than we anticipated.

Over the years we have stayed at several different places around Cambria and Jason's place is by far out favorite. It is very conveniently located a block away from Fiscalini Ranch in a very quiet neighborhood. The front porch is dominated by a beautiful oak tree that adds an incredible character to the place. Inside it is tastefully decorated and equipped with everything that anyone could possibly need, from a giant smart TV to a very good kitchen. The bed is very comfortable and the spacious bathroom has an excellent shower.
Checking in and checking out are as easy as it can be.
Altogether we strongly recommend this place.

review_text:
The perfect AirBnB experience for our small family of three.
The location is easy to get to, and check in is perfect — lockbox and boom, you're in. The place itself was spotless and felt new.
There are two types of places we generally get: ones that feel kinda lived in, and one that feel professionally prepared for rental. This was the second type, and I mean that in a good way. That's exactly what we wanted:
• full, nice kitchen
• nice, clean decor with extra space, because two year old
• close to extended family's house
• better value than the nicer hotels in town
This is it. PLUS the host, Jason, is friendly and professional, with quick response times even during busier periods.
In conclusion: loved it. We will check this place first when we plan our next visit.

Stayed with kids
review_text: Jason’s home is in a lovely location nestled in a quiet neighborhood with trees and nature views. We loved being a quick walk to the Fiscalini Ranch Preserve and short drive to the main part of town! The home is newer with the amenities that make a stay enjoyable - kitchen utensils, pots, pans, etc plus a little fireplace. Two things weren’t quite what I expected - I wasn’t aware that the bedroom upstairs was more of a loft-style without a door to close off the space. This was mainly a concern for me because we were traveling with our infant son and it meant we needed to be extra quiet downstairs while he slept/took naps. I also wasn’t aware that the home was heated with the fireplace/space heaters - I fully admit to not being familiar with homes on the coast so perhaps to most this is common. That being said we still had a lovely time and I would recommend Jason’s place to those wanting to visit Cambria.

The proximity to the Fiscalini Preserve is its best attribute and the walks through there are not to be missed. They provide sweeping views of the coast that you can walk to in a short amount of time. The trails are easy and accessible for most people, even with limited mobility.
But, even just sitting on the porch at the cottage can provide all the wildlife you need, birds, deer, squirrel and bunnies all made their way past us on the deck. A perfectly relaxing mid-term break. These city girls loved it!

name: Come
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This is an exceptionally good place and the host Jason is really going the extra length to make sure that his quests really have a pleasant experience. This is my second stay at this place.
Everything is in very good condition, sparkling clean, uncluttered, convenient and tastefully in a fairly neutral style that should work for most people. The layout of the house on two floors works very well and all rooms are spacious and very well lit with lots of windows. The overall construction is modern and up to high standards with excellent thermal and acoustic insulation. The view from the front porch is to the the small garden with a beautiful oak tree. All of this is in a quiet and pleasant neighborhood frequently visited by deer.
The bedroom does guarantee excellent nights sleep: the bed is very comfortable, there isn't any noise at all and there are very effective blinds on all windows. The room is large and and welcoming with windows on three walls. There is a lot of storage space.
The bathroom is very spacious with a large walk-in shower and everything is sparkling clean and very well kept.
Downstairs is a single combined kitchen living-room. The kitchen is equipped with all the basics for cooking, including a great selection of knives and other utensils, pans, mixing bowls, baking trays, sieves, etc. There is also a selection of consumables that make life a lot easier (quality spices, oil, parchment paper, cling film, etc.). The place isn't really designed for heavy duty cooking as there isn't any kitchen hood. Also, if you are planning anything requiring more specific equipment, it might be better bringing it with you (I don't think that there is any food processor, whisk, juicer, etc.).
On top of that, Jason is clearly committed to making sure that his guests have the best experience. In the unlikely situation where something doesn't work as expected, Jason will promptly address the issue in ways that anyone would find impressive.
Last but not least, this property is in Cambria with easy access to its wonderful coastline, great landscape and fascinating wildlife.

review_text: What a beautiful and relaxing space! We were greeted by the local deer family upon arrival and immediately felt at home. The home is sparkling clean, stylish, & well appointed with all the modern amenities. Our family of 4 slept great on the comfortable master and sofa beds. There is a nice deck, 2 comfy chairs, & a great view for lounging with morning coffee or an evening glass of wine. We really enjoyed the trees, wildlife, & star gazing from those chairs! The Fiscalini nature preserve trailhead is right around the corner and offers beautiful hiking that leads from the forest to the ocean. It is a monarch butterfly haven. We did 3 trails and wished we had time for more! Moonstone beach is a short 6 min drive and downtown Cambria is just across the main road. It’s an adorable town with great restaurants, shops, & antique stores. This location was perfect for us to explore the entire area. We can hardly wait to return! Thank you Jason & Suzie for sharing your lovely home & being such incredible hosts!!

name: Courtney
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
December 2021
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
WOW!!! A 100 out of 10!!! What a great experience Diane provided for our family. We stayed during the Christmas season, and had our toddler twins with us to see the lights at the Cambia Pines Lodge.
The house was decorated for the holiday season, and was IMMACULATELY clean. Not only was it fully stocked for live-in/eat-in, there were special little touches everywhere. I can't image what this house looks like outside the holiday season, but knowing what we know, Diane has a special place for any guest to stay ANY time of year.
Everything you might have forgot and/or need, Diane has you covered. I really could not get over how perfect the house was. Simple things like coffee and sugar, olive oil, and other cooking items (remember we have twins toddlers, we aren't going out to eat anywhere), to loads of towels, shampoo/soap, flashlights by the bed. It was as if I was already at home. Let's not forget the selection of books/DVDs and board games available! WOW! Maybe one of the most thoughtful things Diane included was little signage on the items like the fireplace, or faucets, so you didn't have to guess how they worked. I just adored the attention to detail, and couldn't be more appreciative of how easy Diane made it for us to travel.
Within walking distance to the downtown area if you are relatively capable, otherwise, a very short 2-3 minute drive. Morro Bay is a quick 20-30 minutes down the coast, and there is an outdoor seal colony (way cooler than Moonstone Beach IMO) about 10 minutes away. Yes, Moonstone Beach and the Nature Preserve are also super close, as are most things in Cambria. Paso wineries are a quick 30 minutes over 46. An easy peasy drive that offer a stop on the way into, or out fo Cambia.
Just a perfect little get away. Thank you so much Diane!!!!

I'll be recommending Diane's home to friends traveling to the Central Coast as a lovely getaway.

When you are almost in tears backing out of the driveway you know you enjoyed your stay. This AirBnB experience was THE best time my husband and I have had. We celebrated our 10 year wedding anniversary here and we are more than thankful we did.
The cottage include everything one would need to get out of the grind of your normal day life. A GREAT place to decompress and leave the stress behind.
We will never forget our stay at such a beautiful home. Cambria is a gorgeous coastal town and this cottage is minutes from everything. From downtown to the beautiful beaches from moonstone to ragged point.
Thank you Diane for hosting and sharing your home with us. We will 100% be coming back to unwind again.
Robert and Sarah

review_text: Our stay at the Wine Down Cottage was lovely! Diane is a very attentive host, and responded to all inquiries in a timely manner. She even checked in with us during the week to make sure everything was ok! The house is very comfortable, and has a very well stocked kitchen- there is even an air fryer and an electric teapot. The house set up was great for our small family of 3, with the two bedrooms at opposite ends of the hall. The backyard off the master is a little private oasis! The house was very clean, and the windows were left open between renters, so we felt very safe and comfortable in these Covid times. The location of the house was great- both the beach and downtown were easy drives. We also appreciated the restaurant tips and Cambria information that was left for us. No complaints from us!

We would go back and stay in this home again without any question. Only about a 20 minute walk from downtown Cambria or a less than five minute drive. We hit up all of the local beaches and Stolo winery; again less than 5 miles away for all activities. Truly a central location she has! Thank you Diane for making this home very cozy and comfortable for us. We can’t wait to stay here again on our visit to Cambria!

We had such a wonderful stay! The house was perfect for our group (two families - 4 adults, a toddler, and a baby) and felt stylish, comfortable, and cozy. The property felt very private too, especially the hot tub area! We had high expectations based on the description and pictures and it exceeded them easily. The location is perfect for getting easily to/from downtown Cambria, and was a great home-base for visiting with family in town & a wedding in Ragged Point. Hot tubbing after returning from the wedding was the icing on the cake! We would absolutely stay here again whenever we come back to the area, and I love knowing we could take our pup next time also!
PS, it is next to a fire station, but there were zero noise issues, and the only reason we even knew they were there is because my son went running to the window to yell and wave every time he saw them drive by. :D

name: Tami
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2017
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
The Wine Down Cottage is a beautiful place to stay and having a large fenced-in yard for our three golden retrievers was a bonus. The house is beautifully decorated and updated; we loved the wood-look tile floors.
I was concerned about the fire station right next door, but I NEVER heard a siren (when the truck leaves, it doesn't have the siren on). That being said, the street is busier than I expected, as it's a shortcut from the highway to the East Village of Cambria. We also occasionally heard partiers from the Cambria Pines Lodge, which is practically kitty corner from the cottage. The master bedroom is in the back of the house and we never heard anything when we were in the back. The ceiling fan in the bedroom was wonderful and so quiet!
It was nice to have the hot tub already "on" and hot and ready for a soak at a minute's notice.
The kitchen has everything you need, including spices, herbs, and even a crock pot!
The location is perfect; it's just minutes from East Village Cambria (a few minutes more to West Village), Fiscalini Ranch, 10 minutes to San Simeon (our preferred beach for the dogs), and 10-15 minutes to Hearst Castle. We took day trips to Paso Robles and Morro Bay, which are both only about 30 minutes away. Just a perfect location. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here (our first time to Cambria!) and can't wait to return.

The owners have given a lot of attention to detail and have really succeeded in making this a comfortable and inviting atmosphere.

The home is well laid out; providing private bathrooms/bedrooms for two couples and a convivial open common area for a leisurely breakfast in the morning and relaxing conversation in the evening.

The house is well situated; just minutes up the street from Cambria village. This is a stunning part of California. We had fun exploring the beautiful beach and valley areas of Cambria.

It was the perfect place to meet up with our son and future daughter-in-law and share a special weekend together!

Allison made it very easy for our arrival with quick responses to questions we had as it was a very last minute trip so we did not get all the check in details via email because of our late booking.
As soon as we walked in the door to the house, we were impressed with the quaint and coziness of the home. We were greeted with a handwritten note from Allison welcoming us.
The bed had beautiful linens with a perfectly fluffy down filled duvet that I hope to replicate now that I’m back home.
The kitchen was stocked with everything needed to cook while we were there, Allison was even kind enough to leave coffee pods and cream for us.
The bathroom was equally as clean with cute decor and an amazingly big shower.
The quiet exterior made for a great nights sleep.
We hope to make it back soon as we were not quite ready to go home.
Thank you for letting us enjoy your Carriage House
The Calderon’s

review_text: Sometimes you just feel like a host truly cares about their guests, and that was definitely the case with this beautiful house in Cambria, California, from the thoughtful labeling in the kitchen that helped us find everything we needed to the in-depth handbook to the general standards of upkeep and comfort throughout the experience, we felt at home from the moment we walked in. Cambria is gorgeous and the location of this house makes it easy to take advantage of the beautiful beach and the bluff walking paths just to the north of the house are stunning and easy to experience for anyone. This is a perfect base for experiencing Hearst Castle. Also, make sure to check out the elephant seal refuge, they are extremely interesting animals. we would stay here again in a heartbeat, and are very grateful to host for providing such a warm and welcoming stay.

I have never stayed at a home with such a well stocked kitchen. So many like new pots and pans. Many spices, olive oil and fresh ground coffee. Huge fridge and freezer. The towels were super absorbent and soft. The bed firm but not hard.
The front deck has a nice view of the ocean and is a perfect spot to sip some champagne. There are plenty of books to choose from for a little relaxed reading on the comfy couch or games to play if you are so inclined. It’s a very well appointed home. Recommend it highly and we will be back.

We were enchanted by the natural beauty in every direction to which we could walk. We stayed as long as we could to soak up every last deer 🦌, sea otter 🦦 , dolphin🐬, and seal 🦭. It was important to us that the stay was affordable yet we wanted for nothing.
Thank you, Maria, for everything; we hope we can return to your sweet house and this lovely town again soon.

review_text: The pictures and descriptions all aptly describe the lovely home and we were so comfortable. Maria didn't just make it look pretty for pictures, it's actually that nice. The beds were super comfortable and I'm used to sleeping on a Tempur-Pedic and the house was cozy, warm and quiet. As in they had a proper location for their HVAC unit (yes, I'm that particular since I've learned so many Airbnb houses decide to have them right next to the bedrooms and/or actually in the bedrooms often creating a wind tunnel that sounds like I'm sleeping next to a jet propulsion lab). The furnishings were all spot on and honestly, you can't find a more welcoming host than Maria. I loved all the clear labels and directions. Even check out was simple, which was a relief with two little girls, getting out of the house in the morning is always a bit chaotic. Thank you again Maria for our lovely stay!

Be careful driving as there really are leaping deer like the signs indicate.

name: Tony
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2022
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: This home is a gem and a must if you’re visiting Cambria. It’s a short walk to the Fiscalini Ranch Preserve where we spent almost everyday on the glorious bluff trail. The upstairs living area was full of natural light and had just an overall great vibe. The incredible kitchen was large, super clean and open to the living area so we saved money by cooking and enjoying our meals with an ocean view. The two main bathrooms were large and clean and there’s a cute third bathroom adjacent to the kitchen. The master bedroom was bright and roomy with a walk-in closet. The two bottom bedrooms with queen beds were perfect for our two, teenage sons. They loved having this own rooms for the first time! You’re bound to see deer in your front and backyard everyday. I wouldn’t advise letting children going in the backyard at all, it’s really for the local deer to graze and rest. When we wanted to go outside we just sat on the front and back outside patio decks. The laundry room is terrific! In terms of basic amenities, we really did have everything we needed. All the cabinets in the kitchen and bathrooms are labeled with all the things you might need and everything was super easy to locate. If you plan on doing lots of cooking as we did, I would bring aluminum foil, Pam spray and parchment paper. Pots, pans, baking sheets etc. were all provided by our gracious host. We loved this home so much, I’m not sure we can wait until next summer to go back!

I could not have loved my stay at The Overlook more! Don’t hesitate to book this townhome, you won’t be disappointed. I will definitely stay here again!
Property is perfectly set up inside and out. Waking up to pink clouds at sunrise and a view out over the ocean from in bed is a dream! Outside patio is expansive and gives lots of extra living space. (Has great patio furniture too!)
I came for the Cambria Christmas Market and walked short distance into town to catch the free shuttle. Also walked from the townhouse to Moonstone Boardwalk. You can drive if you want, but I loved the flexibility to be able to walk and enjoy more of the town. Did a holiday lights tour of Hearst Castle as well and just 10 minute drive north. Truly a perfect trip. So much to do in Cambria. Lisa had great maps and magazines of activities as well. The home is incredibly comfortable and relaxing.

Stayed about a week
review_text:
We had a wonderful stay at The Overlook in Cambria! The apartment is spacious, spotlessly clean, super comfortable, and the views are even better than the photos. It's an ideal location for getting into town, to the beach, or exploring along Highway 1 or farther inland. Loved the balcony especially -- the perfect spot to relax and watch the sunset. Lisa has taken such care with the unit and it really shows.
The only thing to note is, as others have mentioned, this is the bottom floor of a two-story unit and the walls are thin. We stayed for a week and the upstairs guest during that time was quiet -- it wasn't a problem. However our last night, new guests arrived who were very loud -- kids running until well after we'd have liked to have been asleep, and adults whose conversations (shouting) we could hear word for word. So it's a roll of the dice, depending on who you overlap with. We loved our stay but it would have been a different story had we arrived when we were leaving.

review_text:
The “Overlook” is up in the hills of Cambria with an outdoor terrace spanning the length of the townhouse that boasts a lovely view of the Moonstone Beach coast and the areas below. It is private and quiet. The decor has a Mid-Century Modern feel, coordinated with warm colors and nice textures. No luxury was spared - Lisa thought of everything! The bathroom is divided, making it easy and convenient for 2 people to use at the same time. The shower was huge with good, strong water pressure. There is ample storage (& hanging hooks!) throughout the unit and plenty of seating, including a desk. Just a beautiful place to stay! Highly recommend booking it.
Our only regret is that we didn’t stay longer, 2 nights was not long enough to explore this idyllic little town with restaurants, shopping and things to do aplenty!
Thank you, Lisa.

review_text:
Lisa’s place is just like the photos. The views are nice, the place is very clean and comfy, and the amenities a plus. It’s in a prime location too.
I didn’t know the upper floor would be occupied by someone other than Lisa. I do have to say that I was not expecting there to be as much noise as there was from those staying above us. With that being said, we could hear almost every foot step (which sometimes shook the dishes). I let Lisa know after their conversations were becoming louder as well. The conversations were quieter but the loud foot steps persisted.
I came to the Airbnb for some quiet time and unless i was watching tv to drown it out or stayed outside, we could hear a lot from above. Also, the smells of strong cooking came through the door as well, so just an fyi it might fill the unit you are in for a while unless you open the windows. Just keep that in mind since this is a downstairs unit.

Our 13yo daughter slept on the pull out couch and we were able to make it really comfortable with the linens and blankets provided. The kitchen is well stocked and the shower is terrific. There was a pod coffee maker but we were happy to find a good ol' drip coffee maker in the cabinet, definitely our preference. So nice to have options! We loved walking down the big hill into town, and loved knowing we were getting a good workout walking back up the hill. :)
Overall our stay was really wonderful. We were a little surprised at how much we could hear the footsteps and conversations upstairs, but we were traveling with a tower fan and that white noise definitely helped.

review_text: This light and airy unit was extremely clean, and looks just like the pictures. If you are sensitive to noise it is worth knowing that this is a lower unit, and the upstairs unit is definitely audible (footsteps, music, voices, etc) from below, especially from the living room area. Easy, quick drive from the unit to the cute town of Cambria (both sides) and the ocean is right across the highway. Parking was plentiful and free everywhere we went. Be sure to wear sunscreen on the beach trails and boardwalk even if it looks foggy/hazy out!

And on our second night there, we spotted 6 different whales migrating south as the sun was setting! The house had everything we might need for a comfortable stay, and Lisa was a fantastic host that gave us complete privacy. We hope to come back soon!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Overlook is a fabulous apt. Walking distance to town . The private deck has a perfect ocean view and comfortable furniture to watch sunsets from and sip tea or coffee in the morning . The kitchenette area is fully stocked with everything you need to keep snacks and breakfast items there . We even had take out one night in the apt. The bedroom is super comfy and you can wake up in the morning and look right out the big windows at the morning ocean view . The living space is spacious . Parking is easy and check in so convenient . Nice private entrance. We loved using the apt as a base for exploring neighboring Paso Robles wineries , day hikes and walks south at Morrow bay , local walks and hikes at Moonstone beach and Fiscallini preserve and elephant seal watching up north a few miles . Many fabulous restaurants downtown and bakeries and coffee shops . Can’t wait to go back and stay longer . Thank you Lisa

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Overlook epitomizes coastal California indoor-outdoor living.  It will be hard to tear yourself away from the gorgeous deck -- with its ocean vista surrounded by Spanish moss -- ideal for morning coffee and evening wine, as the sunset paints a dramatic sky.  And, yet, you will also be drawn inside to the space's inspiring mid-century decor, cozy corners, and thoughtful details throughout.  Just down the road are an array of adventures to explore -- from eats and antiques on Main Street to hikes through the Fiscalini Preserve to strolls along Moonstone Beach.  The Overlook is truly the perfect home base, and Lisa and Jerry are the most gracious hosts.

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text: We had a good stay at the overlook. I appreciated that the guest bed was made in the living room upon arrival. The unit is tastefully appointed and thoughtfully laid out. We were chilly the first night but there is a space heater to use. The large outside deck faces both highway 1 and the ocean so you do get some road noise but when the mist clears, the beach is in view. We enjoyed sitting outside on the deck and it’s a plus for this airbnb. The small kitchen/ kitchenette allows one to cook some simple meals but will be difficult for more elaborate cooking, as we discovered when trying to make dinner. Something to note is the upstairs is occupied and there is very little sound insulation so they could probably hear us as we could hear them. The upstairs occupant’s deck is right above the Airbnb’s deck so at times it did not feel very private. The host was very responsive and that was helpful and appreciated-thanks for the stay!

The kitchen and bathroom had all the essentials, and the view from the porch is unbeatable. I would definitely recommend staying here for a tranquil getaway in Cambria.

name: Karen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2021
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: Lisa and Jerry's place is amazing! Spotless, tasteful, and comfortable - a treat for the senses! All the special touches are perfect. They are gracious and kind hosts - excellent communication and helpful - they are available if you have questions or need anything, but not intrusive. The location of the Overlook is wonderful! The deck has a stunning view and is perfect for morning coffee and/or an afternoon glass of wine - stargazing too - I even saw the lunar eclipse! The Overlook is an ideal home base from which to explore the gorgeous Central coast - north and south you can't go wrong. When I first started researching and planning my week getaway, the Overlook was a wee bit out of my budget but after looking at the photos I decided to go for it - it is worth every penny! - I will stay again in a heartbeat!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is probably the best Airbnb I've had the pleasure to visit. Perfect location for frequent visits to downtown Cambria or the beach. Very comfortable living space, and large deck with lots of furniture for relaxing. Gorgeous view of Moonstone Beach as well. Just a great place to relax and enjoy your time on the coast. Nicely stocked kitchenette for simple breakfast and lunch for a break from eating out (not that you would want to! So many yummy food options near by) It does get a tad cold at night, but host had 2 space heaters and lots of blankets available and it was very cozy to sleep with the heater on. Such friendly owners who we saw in passing, but had short, lovely interactions with as we came and went. 10/10!

The kitchenette is also sufficient for simple meals. The entire place is great but the view is something else. We spent many hours on the deck just taking in the views. The pictures don’t do justice to the view. We’ll be back here soon. A great place to just relax over a weekend. The location is also great for other activities.
